Name: Statuette of a steersman (?)
Description: The statuette represents a standing man wearing a knee-long garment and a wig covering his ears. The body is painted red, the garment is white, the wig, brows and eyelids are black. Since both arms are lost, any attribution of the statuette is tentative, but it is highly probable that it was an image of a pilot standing on a prow of a model ritual boat.
